title: Data Science- Statistics Percentiles

metadata.description: Learn about Data Science- Statistics Percentiles with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
25%, 50% and 75% - Percentiles
Percentiles are used in statistics to give you a number that describes the 
value that a given percent of the values are lower than.
Let us try to explain it by some examples, using Average_Pulse.
The 25% percentile of Average_Pulse means that 25% of all of the training 
sessions have an average pulse of 100 beats per minute or lower. If we flip 
the statement, it means that 75% of all of the training sessions have an average pulse of 100 
beats per minute or higher
The 75% percentile of Average_Pulse means that 75% of all the training 
session have an average pulse of 111 or lower. If we flip the statement, it 
  means that 25% of 
all of the training sessions have an average pulse of 111 beats per minute or 
higher
Task: Find the 10% percentile for Max_Pulse
The following example shows how to do it in Python:
Example
import numpy as np
Max_Pulse= full_health_data["Max_Pulse"]
percentile10 = np.percentile(Max_Pulse, 10)
print(percentile10)

Max_Pulse = full_health_data["Max_Pulse"] - Isolate the variable Max_Pulse from the full health data set.
np.percentile() is used to define that we want the 10% percentile from Max_Pulse.
The 10% percentile of Max_Pulse is 120. This means that 10% of all the training sessions have a Max_Pulse of 120 or lower.

★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
import numpy as np
Max_Pulse= full_health_data["Max_Pulse"]
percentile10 = np.percentile(Max_Pulse, 10)
print(percentile10)

quiz.question:
What is Percentiles
Percentiles are used in statistics to give you a number that describes the 
value that a given percent of the values?
options:
that 25% of all of the training 
sessions have an average pulse of 100 beats per minute or lower
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of Percentiles
Percentiles are used in statistics to give you a number that describes the 
value that a given percent of the values is 'lower than'.

quiz.question: What is Pulse?
options:
that 25% of all of the training 
sessions have an average pulse of 100 beats per minute or lower
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of Pulse is 'that 25% of all of the training 
sessions have an average pulse of 100 beats per minute or lower'.

summary: This tutorial covers Data Science- Statistics Percentiles concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Data Science- Statistics Percentiles effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Data Science- Statistics Percentiles and how to apply it in your projects.
